jot.math.geometry

Class PolygonMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • jot.math.geometry.Mesh
      • jot.math.geometry.PolygonMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HOG2Map.HOG2MapMesh, MorphingMesh, SkinnedMesh

    public class PolygonMesh
extends Mesh
    Class that represents a 3D geometry, i.e., it contains vertices, normals, and textureCoords values, and the ordered indexes information required to render them.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class jot.math.geometry.Mesh

        Mesh.PrimitiveType

      The display list pointer used to render the geometry.

      Get the size of each normal, i.e., the number of terms required for each normal.
      int getPrimitiveType()
      Get the primitive type to use when rendering if the setPrimitiveType method is never called default is TRIANGLES.

      Gets this mesh texture coordinates indices values.

      Get all textureCoords values as a string, i.e., convert the texture data buffer into a string.

      Gets this mesh texture coordinates values.
      int getTextureCoordSize()
      Get the size of each textureCcoord, i.e., the number of terms required for each textureCoord, e.g., if using S,T values it would be 2.

      Get all the triangles of this mesh.

      Get the triangles count for this mesh.

      • PolygonMesh

        public PolygonMesh()
        Constructor where the default primitive to render (GL_TRIANGLES) is specified. Also, where the number of dimensions per vertex, normal, and textureCoord.

      • setIndexStride

        public void setIndexStride(int indexStride)
        Set the stride between indexes, e.g., a vertex, normals, and textureCoords are 3. This is required in the render process.
        Specified by:
        setIndexStride in class Mesh
        Parameters:
        indexStride - the integer value of the primitive to use, e.g., QUADS.
